summary: This is a prosecutor's note documenting a brief, non-substantive video conference on May 3, 2021, with an unnamed individual regarding testifying at trial. The individual made two remarks suggesting the prosecution interview Ghislaine Maxwell's personal assistant and noted the assistant is having a hard time emotionally due to press coverage.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the individual whose personal assistant was mentioned by the unnamed conference participant as someone the prosecution should interview.

events.title: Video Conference Regarding Trial Testimony
events.description: A brief, non-substantive video conference was held with an unnamed individual to discuss testifying at trial. The individual made two substantive remarks suggesting an interview with Maxwell's personal assistant.

locations.name: One Saint Andrew's Plaza
locations.context: Address of the Assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York, in New York, NY.

locations.name: New York, NY
locations.context: Location of the U.S. Attorney's office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The document is a prosecutor's note from a video conference on May 3, 2021, regarding trial testimony.
An unnamed participant suggested the prosecution should interview Ghislaine Maxwell's personal assistant, noting they are friends.
The participant also remarked that Maxwell's personal assistant is having a hard time emotionally due to press coverage.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs.
The conversation was brief and not substantive, and was not considered an interview.
